div1.p: In the District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division.
In the Matter of the Application of Antonio Bisegna, alias Disegna, for Writ of Habeas Corpus. } No. 2679 Order Granting Writ

On reading and filling the petition of Antonio Bisegna, duly signed and verified by him, whereby it appears that he is illegally imprisoned and restrained from his liberty by the United States Commissioner of Immigration at the King Kitsah county jail in the City of Seattle, in said County, State of Washington, and stating wherein the illegality exists, from which it appears to me that a Writ of Habeas Corpus ought to be issued.

It is Therefore Ordered, that a Writ of Habeas Corpus issue out of and under the seal of the District Court of the United States of the Western District of Washington, Northern Division directed, to the said Henry M. White, United States Commissioner of Immigration, commanding him to have the body of the said Antonio Bisenga before me in the court room of said court on the 20th day of Feburary, 1914, at 10 6 o'clock A.6M. of that day, to do and recieve what shall then and there be considered concerning the said Antonio Bisegna, together with the time and cause of his detention, and that he have then and there said Writ.
Dated in said District on the 16th day of Feburary, 1914.
In the District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington Northern Division B0B-4-398
In the Matter of the Application of Antonio Bisegna, alias Disegna, for Writ of Habeas Corpus.

Order Granting Writ.</
Filed in the U.S. District Court, Western Dist. of Washington Nothern Divison Feb 16 1914 Frank L. Crosby, Clerk, By EML Deputy
Service of papers in this case may be made upon Alfred H. Lundin and Louis E. Shela Attorneys for Petitioner at No. Street Room 811 Lowman Bldg. Block Seattle, Washington.
Lowman & Hanforn Co. Seattle, Wash. - Form No. 102
